author: abendix@businessinsider.com (Aria Bendix), Aria Bendix
title: Children still represent only 2% of coronavirus cases — but could be facilitating its spread. Here's the latest research on kids and COVID-19.
description: Getty Few children have gotten the coronavirus relative to their share of the population. Those who get sick are more likely to be asymptomatic or develop mild symptoms compared to adults. That could mean they unknowingly transmit the virus to others. Infants…
content:
Since the early days of the coronavirus outbreak, it has been clear that children are less likely to experience coronavirus symptoms — or any symptoms at all — compared to adults.
Among the first 425 coronavirus patients studied in Wuhan, China, in December … [+4872 chars]
